INVALID JSON TEST CASES
=======================

This file contains various malformed JSON examples for error testing.
Each example is separated by a line of dashes.

---
CASE 1: Missing closing bracket
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John"}

---
CASE 2: Missing closing brace
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John"
]

---
CASE 3: Trailing comma
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John"},
  {"id": 2, "name": "Jane"},
]

---
CASE 4: Missing quotes around key
[
  {id: 1, "name": "John"}
]

---
CASE 5: Single quotes instead of double quotes
[
  {'id': 1, 'name': 'John'}
]

---
CASE 6: Missing comma between objects
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John"}
  {"id": 2, "name": "Jane"}
]

---
CASE 7: Missing colon
[
  {"id" 1, "name": "John"}
]

---
CASE 8: Unclosed string
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John}
]

---
CASE 9: Invalid escape sequence
[
  {"id": 1, "path": "C:\invalid\path"}
]

---
CASE 10: Not an array or object (plain text)
This is just plain text, not JSON at all.

---
CASE 11: Empty file (this would be tested separately)


---
CASE 12: Extra closing bracket
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John"}
]]

---
CASE 13: Missing opening bracket
  {"id": 1, "name": "John"}
]

---
CASE 14: Duplicate keys
[
  {"id": 1, "name": "John", "name": "Jane"}
]

---
CASE 15: Invalid number format
[
  {"id": 01, "value": 123.456.789}
]

---
CASE 16: Unquoted string value
[
  {"id": 1, "name": John}
]

---
CASE 17: Missing value
[
  {"id": 1, "name": }
]

---
CASE 18: Extra comma at start
[
  ,{"id": 1, "name": "John"}
]

---
CASE 19: Invalid boolean
[
  {"id": 1, "active": True}
]

---
CASE 20: Invalid null
[
  {"id": 1, "value": NULL}
]
